He sits staring right through us...the thousand-yard star A strange white unreal light washes over him. The only co the Navy and gold of the stripes on his shoulderboards. A rumbling mumbling filters through the HISS of surf or fan something...Snatches of low whispered  conversation....disregard of...basic air-safety  principles...too aggressive...incident.... 29 July...with performance parameters... disciplinary action...tactical  doctrine.... even reckless at times...  conjecture...unsupported ...benefit of the doubt...
Maverick's  eyes slowly focus. The light attenuates. The surrounding  image becomes denser. Things become real.

A BOARD OF INQUIRY, a COMMANDER and other NAVY OFFICERS  seated behind tables at the front of the room. Maverick f them, wearing dress whites. Viper is also present. The  Commander looks at each of the Officers. They each nod, i turn, indicating readiness. The Commander turns to Maveri and states for the record:
The Board of Inquiry finds that Lt.  Evan Mitchell was not at fault in  the accident of twenty-nine July.
No response from Maverick, one way or the other. Viper  studies his face with concern.
Lt. Mitchell's record will be  cleared of this incident.
Lt. Mitchell is restored to flight  status without further delay. These  proceedings are closed.
Maverick lies on his bunk and stares at the ceiling. The  phone next to his bed is RINGING.  It RINGS EIGHT OR NINE TIMES, then stops. He makes no move to reach for it.

Maverick sits in the cockpit staring at the controls whil the ground crew preps the aircraft for flight. Coogan hel him strap in. He speaks solicitously to Maverick. It is  unheard over the JET NOISE and RADIO BABBLE. Maverick loo at the cockpit as if it's a strange territory, suddenly  foreign to him. He grabs the stick like it's some peculia talisman. He turns and looks aft. He seems surprised that moves the control surfaces in the tails.

head_text.subj: BOGEY AT TEN O'CLOCK LOW. YOU'VE

text: Maverick checks ten o'clock low. He is disturbed. He trie to make the move, but he is a man with no secret: he is  afraid.
The bogey abruptly turns into him. Maverick hesitates. Th suddenly, he jerks the stick hard right and takes the F-1 away from the bogey at great speed. Fungus is startled.
Jester walks up to Viper who waits near an F-5.
He just won't engage. He can't do  it, Skipper. He can't get back on  the horse.
It's only been a week. Keep sending  him up.
Some guys never get it back.
Maverick grabs his stuff out of the locker, throws them i bag. He glances up as Fungus enters, continues to pack.
Since when did you care about   paperwork?
Maverick walks away. Fungus hesitates, then follows him.
If I could fly like you I'd have  everything I want. If I could fly  at all. I can't fly. I can't fly  like that. Nobody can. Whatever it  is, you've got it!
So, you're scared--so what? You  ever get a good look at me in the  back seat, I'm goddamn terrified.
Grabbing the suitcase, Maverick brushes past Jester and  walks up the corridor. Jester and Fungus watch him go. Fu goes to the phone.
Charlie parks her car, jumps out, and runs toward the mai entrance to the terminal.

Charlie hurries through the crowd, bumping past people,  searching frantically for Maverick in the huge terminal. moves past bench after bench, and her eyes flick in all  directions. A quick glance at the souvenir shop, the coff shop, and then she heads for the bar.

Maverick is there, sitting alone in a booth with his  suitcase beside him, staring into a drink. Charlie compos herself, then walks to the booth and sits down across the table from him. Maverick does not look pleased.
He looks up trying to be angry, but he can't help it, she makes him laugh.
You came to the right place.
I'll have what he's having...  Hemlock, is it?
The waitress departs. He tries not to smile, but can't he it.
Long distance? I wouldn't do that  to you. I'd at least talk to you.
I didn't want to see you. I mean, I  did...but I didn't..
I know exactly what you mean.

I've got a gift just like you do.  My gift is I just know what people  mean, even if they can't say it. It  helps when you're trying to  communicate with fighter pilots.  Like what you just said was "I'm  embarrassed, I feel I've done  something wrong, that I've failed,  and I don't think I can live up to  the expectations of a wonderful  interesting, intelligent woman like  yourself." That about it?
And I'm gonna sneak off, and be by  myself for awhile, like until I can  think of a new career...hotel  management or something...
Big talk for someone who's never  been shot off her computer.

Hey, I never said I was a fighter  pilot...I never claimed to think it  was fun to be shot off the end of a  ship in a storm. I can find  contentment in a good book. I don't  have to roar by someone at Mach two  with my hair on fire. Sometimes...I  just get happy being with the right  man.

I think I have... I could be wrong.  I have been before. Just remember  one thing. If you're not Top Gun,  if you're not fighting jets, you're  not gonna be able to act like a  fighter pilot... You're gonna have  to act like the rest of us. You're  gonna have to master humility. For  you guys, that's the toughest  maneuver of all.
She gets up...lays a bill out for the drinks...
So long, Sailor. See you on the  beach sometime.
She swings away. Her wake sucks in the stares of every ma in the place. Then they look over to Maverick, quick flic of envy in their eyes. He stares them back and can't quit meet their eyes.

Viper is tugged down the beach by a three year old kid. T come across one creature who's had a bad night...Viper sp him, he spots Viper, and Viper moves toward him. Tim, Vip kid, wants to head for the sea and pulls his father in th direction. He stops, puts his hand on his hips like he's the pilots do.
Dad...Of all the aminals in the  ocean, which one's the baddest?
I don't know, Tim. You'll have to  ask them.
Viper turns to the creature, Maverick, and shrugs.
She said you took your kid to the   each. Every second Sunday. Zoo or  beach or the ballgame. Y'have the  option...(Maverick thinks for a  beat. Segues to the question...)  What about me?

We can send you back to your  squadron with nothing noted on your  record except "CNC" --course not  completed, no explanation required.  Theoretically, it doesn't hurt your  career, but people always wonder  about things like that.
I didn't know either. That's why I  told Jester to prepare your papers.
Maverick looks irritated. Viper stops at an icecream vend and orders three with a gesture.
You've already made up your mind.
It's no disgrace, kid. That spin  was hell. It would wreck anyone's  confidence. You could be a good  pilot again someday...
(starts to get his back up) You think I should quit?!
I didn't say that. That's up to  you. But I have responsibility for  the other guys up there, not just  you. They need to know you're all  right...that they can depend on  you.
The vendor hands them icecream, they take it.
Here, let me get this. We'll be  even.

He reaches into his pocket for change, comes out with a  handful. Slams it on the counter, stars picking the prope change out. Viper spots something and reaches for  it...Maverick sees and tries to block it, but Viper comes with the Navy Cross.
But Viper recognizes it for what it is.
Sometimes it's luck, but in this  case, he earned it... I served with  your old man.
VF 51, the Oriskany. You remind me  of him. You're just like he was,  only better...and worse.
You may not think so, but you are.
He was by the book, all the way.
They waved him off. He thought he  knew better. He hit the  ramp.
Viper looks at him, for a long beat, throws his icecream  away.
He turns, walks away. Maverick stands there for a moment, thinking, then catches up to him, stops him...struggles w the thought...as Viper breaks in...  VIPER

You start on a wrong heading... the  more you stick to it, the further  you get from your target. A good  pilot always questions himself,  always questions his judgments,  stays alert for drift and makes the  corrections...You may find a little  discipline helps with the fear. You  don't have to be alone up there.
How can I go on? I feel so...  responsible.

Kid, the plain fact is...you are.  I'm not gonna stand here and blow  sunshine up your ass. Technically,  they absolved you. You and I know  what really happened. You pushed  it. You are responsible and you'll  always carry that. You know what,  I'll carry it too. I should have  taken you out of that cockpit. I guess I'm a hopeless romantic...  I always try to find something  worthwhile in someone's death. It's  no trade-off. It's not one for one.  What you learned isn't worth his  death. It couldn't be. But maybe  there is some value in it. I know  it's the first thing I've ever seen  that's really gotten to you. Now  the question is, what will you do  with it. If it gets you out of  flight status...so you don't kill  yourself or anybody else...that's  good. That's one good thing. You  were an accident waiting to  happen.
I didn't say that. That's up to  you. I think that if you do, if you  choose to come back, you'll be a  better pilot... a better man.
Would you take me back? Would they?

I'll have to think about it. I  don't know about them. I do know  one thing, We've got a lot invested  in you. We'd hate to lose it. Even  more than those other guys, Naval  Aviation needs a very few, very  good men.

LOUD ROCK AND ROLL. The graduation ceremonies are in full swing...They consist of informal ribbing, laughing, and a of talking with the hands. every now and then, the name G comes up and a shadow passes across a face. For the most  part, they press on, having a good time. Fungus shrugs at someone's question and looks around.
I don't know where he is...

Ice stands proudly holding the Top Gun plaque as others  congratulate him...Hollywood looks up as the door opens,  Maverick is there.  He looks uncomfortable, unsure. He se Ice with the plaque. Fungus moves over to him, brings him FUNGUS
One by one, they come over, shake his hand. Viper stands  there, looking pleased but gruff. Maverick walks over, sh his hand. The party starts to pick up. A real celebration now.

Jester enters, a sheaf of messages in his hand. He takes  Viper aside for a word. Viper nods at him. The group's  attention gradually swings onto them. They quiet down  instinctively. Viper finally turns to them.
Gentlemen, you know how I hate to  break up this party before it has a  chance to get really out of hand... (more serious) ...but there's a major flap on.
You're on your way. Don't bother  going to BOQ. Your bags are packed.
He hands them orders. Someone turns the music back up... they shake hands all around, the music grows, becomes pur as the background voices drop out.

To include his helmet. Stereo headphones from his walkman carry the same music from the party as he sits in the coc and stares at the grey water rushing under. He sits in hi Tomcat on Ready 5 Alert. In the back, Fungus plays a hand computer game - Jet Attack.
Maverick's Tomcat sits waiting for a launch order on the  forward catapult.
He goes over the briefing in his mind...Stinger's voice  breaks through the music.:
...Navy oceanographic ship...  international waters... fired  upon... unknown forces...
In full flight gear, sixteen teams of fighter pilots and  RIO's pay close attention to the Squadron CO, Stinger.
...by unknown forces...by Migs. We  don't know who they are.  All I  know is that it's our ship, and our  orders are to escort it out of the  area.
Stinger circles an area on the map.
He studies his copy of the same map, headings and vectors pencilled in.

This is "Bullseye". A rescue  operation is to begin within the  hour. Your mission is to give air  support to that rescue. There are  MiGs in the area, and tensions are  high. If you witness a hostile act  you will return fire. We will be  covering 360 degrees of the compass  by section. Be prepared for  anything.
Stinger is speaking to individual pilots.
He turns to Maverick who stands nearby.
And Maverick. You'll back them up,  on Ready Five.
A moment's disappointment passes so fleetingly, you hardl see it.
As the aircrews file out, tense but excited.

head_text.subj: ICE AND HOLLYWOOD FLY TOGETHER AT TEN THOUSAND FEET

text: Their eyes search the horizon, while Slider and Wolfman  watch their instruments.
The two jets streak across the sky.
Suddenly, there are BLIPS on the radar scope.
Two MiGs flying low to the deck.

head_text.subj: TALLY HO. TWO MIGS AT TWO
118C. THE MIGS SUDDENLY PULL VERTICAL, STREAK STRAIGHT U
I'VE GOT TWO MORE BOGEYS COMING IN

text: Join together in a box formation, begin to circle the are
2-7-0 at 10 MILES. WE NEED SOME  HELP HERE, MUSTANG.

head_text.subj: MUSTANG, WE HAVE FOUR MIGS IN THE

text: Maverick sits in his Tomcat on the Catapult on ready aler listening to the message traffic. He gets a launch order, turns to the LSO. The LSO salutes, Maverick salutes and f him the bird. The LSO drops to the deck. Maverick is slam back as the F-14 is fired off the deck and rockets into t sky.
The two MiGs cross in a scissor pattern in their path... provocation...they join together again and fly level at t thousand feet. One of the MiGs does a sudden canopy roll.
BOOM! A FLASH! Suddenly, Out of nowhere, Hollywood's hit. WHAM! Just that fast, he's hit and goes down.  His f-14  disappears into the clouds.
Ice puts his nose down and follows him.

head_text.subj: IS HIT. GOING DOWN. WILL ATTEMPT

text: He comes out of clouds at 1500, nothing but empty water  below. ICE
Do you have them? Did they get out  or not?

head_text.subj: VOODOO, GHOST RIDER ONE. I'M ON THE
THEY GOT WOLF, THEY GOT WOOD. THEY
ROGER. ENGAGING. I HAVE THE LEAD.

text: Let's go! Dive on those bastards!
Come on, man, engage. This is it.  Get your nose in there.
Maverick hesitates again. He sees the hornet's nest below planes all over the sky.
Bandit at seven o'clock low--solo.  Take him. Pull on the goddamn  stick, man!
Don't tell me okay. Do it!

Maverick draws a breath, then forces himself to pull the  stick over. The F-14 rolls in hard toward the battle.  Suddenly, the cluster breaks apart. The MiGs break in eve direction as Maverick BLASTS through their formation.  Something comes up through the clouds. A MiG BLASTS by.  Another rolls in and locks onto them.
The MiGs swarm toward the TOMCATS, coming from every  direction. CANNON FIRE erupts from one of the MiGs.

The F-14's execute a left oblique turn in unison. They co down in a section attack with their cannons blazing. From Maverick's cockpit, everything looks choppy:  MiGs slide at incredible speed. Cannons BLAST, as the planes scrambl for position.
Out-numbered four to two, Maverick and Ice fight  defensively. Maverick has the angle on a MIG, when Fungus spots a missile launch.
Maverick releases a flare as he takes the F-14 into a har left. The missile tracks the heat of the flare and sails of the area, missing the Tomcat and falling toward the se

head_text.subj: TWO MIGS ON MY TAIL, MAVERICK. I'M

text: Maverick jerks his stick right and streaks toward Ice. He cuts off one of the MiGs with CANNON FIRE, driving it dow toward the deck. Ice goes into vertical and comes around gain an angle on the other MiG. His RIO is in position to check Mav's rear.
Maverick turns to look and jerks a hard left. The MiG is him, CANNON BLAZING. Ice Yo Yos inside and cuts the MiG o ICE
He fires a sidewinder. The MiG turns hard, the missile sa away.
Ice's F-14 is suddenly caught in a HAIL OF CANNON FIRE as MiG sweeps down from three o'clock. He breaks, dives. The jets streak across the sky, low to the deck, skimming the surface.
Maverick's F-14 Rollaways in and intercepts the bogey on  Ice's tail.
Ice turns right, the MiG bugs and jerks into vertical.   Maverick swoops after him.

head_text.subj: STAY WITH HIM. YOUR SIX IS CLEAR.

text: Maverick closes, jerking left, right, twisting and turnin staying on his tail.

BULLETS fly by Maverick's F-14 from the MiG on his six. H pulls a hard left, then takes the plane straight up. We h instructions shouted by Fungus, but it is all obscured in SOUNDS AND FURY OF THE BATTLE. Maverick peels over the to and comes down like a comet. A series of passes at the Mi As they come by, one of the MiGs pulls up,

head_text.subj: OKAY, GOING UP. ICE, GO HIGH.

text: They look up. An MiG 21 is coming down, belly to them, cl to a mid-air collision.
He pushes down. The MiG ROARS BY. The whole airplane goes "BOOOMMMM" it's that close.

The shock, the air pressure SLAMS them as it goes by,  missing by 4-5 feet. Maverick pulls back in, sees a MiG 2 below. It takes off, bugging out. Ice goes after him. The maneuvers, jerking hard left, hard right, twisting  up, d
Ice is right in his shadow. They come in hard and low ove the sea. He has the MiG in the diamond.
The missile goes by the tail.
Then his tail comes off, the airplane goes over, a chute  comes out. The MiG EXPLODES into a thousand small pieces. They roar by the MiG pilot hanging in his straps.

head_text.subj: I GOT ONE HERE. ON THE NOSE.

text: Rolling down on him, good SIDEWINDER TONE. The MiG'S sens him, they break, one guy down low.
The vapor trail comes off, the MiG 21 turns like he's bee bounced off a rubber wall, comes around on the missile, b it. The missile flies by him.
MiG comes back turning into him.
He looks back. 30 millimeter tracers go by; they just kin of float. He breaks, hits airbrakes, the trailing MiG div through.
Suddenly another MiG appears, rocketing straight for him. They close at 900 knots--VABOOOM!--They pass nose to nose canopy to canopy. Both planes pitch straight up, trying f the altitude advantage.

The F-14 outclimbs the MiG sitting on its tail, full  thruster, it rockets straight up, away from the planet.   Maverick has the advantage. Suddenly, his F-14 runs out o energy. FUNGUS is the first to call it.
The plane backs down on itself, backs into its own smoke it flips over, falls away...He catches it, just regains  control, when...A ROAR. He looks up.

SECOND MIG coming down. Right on him. It fills the Canopy Instinctive - A Push to miss him, Maverick breaks fast do into him, a last ditch maneuver, and the airplane  DEPARTS...the roll rates and the pitch rates combine and tumbles over the top; the airplane just goes end-over-end They are being slammed and rattled all over the  cockpits...bone-jarring, neck-snapping whips. SHRIEKS and SCREAMS from the airframe. Terriflying?
(strangely calm) Goddamnit, Mav, you really are a  slow learner. Don't worry, Fung,  I've got it.
Fungus is getting his teeth rattled. He's helpless, he ha no controls, there's nothing he can do but hold on.
Don't WORRY!!!?   You've GOT it!!?  Are you CRAZY?
The plane's gyrations are rattling Fungus's helmet off th canopy.
You've got it?   Good!  Cause for a  minute there, you had me worried.
It yaws and rolls, starts into a spin.
Now have you got it?  Have you  still got it?

They're in a progressive spiral, nose low.  The altimeter unwinds, speed picks up. The G forces are forcing them aw from the axis of spin, jamming Maverick against the  instrument panel at the front of the cockpit.
Fungus, also, is jammed to his panel.

He is closer to the center of spin and less strongly held It doesn't do much good, however, he can't control the pl The only thing he can reach is the yellow and black loop; ejection handle. He reaches for it.
Fungus's eyes are wide.  The earth grows larger as it ris towards them. G forces flatten them. They've long since l the MiG. Nobody but an idiot would try to follow them in maneuver.
FUNGUS grabs the ejection handle with both hands.
What are you talking about, we gotta go!
The jet is standing on its nose, gaining speed, plunging  towards the ocean.
3,000 feet.  We gotta go, man.   3,000 feet, we gotta go!
You go. I'm staying with it.
Then, just as suddenly, as he's about to pull...Maverick  catches it. The plane responds. They're out of the spin. gets control. Fungus sits there dumbly, hands on handle.  Still not believing...

Maverick stops the tumble, pulls the nose up quickly and F-l4 sweeps into level flight no more than a hundred feet above the deck. He comes up and looks right at Ice. Ice i down low. He comes around, a MiG-21 all over him like a c suit. A flick, a whip, and Maverick in perfect position,  rolls right in on the MiG. Fungus looks like he just saw  Jesus.
He looks at the Mig target set-up in front of him in awe.
Did you plan that? Was all that  something you planned?
Maverick's acquired the target and is all business.

head_text.subj: STARBOARD, THEN EXTEND TO THE EAST.

text: Because...if that was... Next time  you tell me first.
Maverick breaks down, Ice zooms up, breaks in and takes t MiG the other way. Maverick Yo Yo's in, comes right up be the MiG, as the MiG starts acceleration.
Maverick rolls in on Ice and the MiG.

head_text.subj: I GOT A WINDER LEFT, BUT NO GOOD
I CAN'T LOSE HIM, CAN YOU GET OFF
I GOT NO TONE. IT MIGHT GET YOU.
WHEN I SHOOT, YOU BREAK LEFT..3..2

text: Ice breaks left, drops flares. The MiG's missile follows flares. Maverick FIRES. The missile doesn't twitch. It fl right up the tail pipe of the MiG, the canopy flies off, pilot comes out of it, and then the MiG blows up, We go r through the fire ball. VVVARRRUOOMMM!
The MiG rolls into the ground...KABOOM!  They swoop by th pilot, hanging in his straps...He watches them, dumbly.  Fungus waves.
What a dope! Maybe they'll give him another plane...and we can shoot him down again.
Maverick and Ice join up, light it, stand on their burner and blast straight for the sun.
Without warning, a triple roll, as the elation hits him.
Fungus nervously looks around at his circuit breakers.
Is there something I should know?
Yeah, I guess it is. We did it! We  did it...Damn! We sure did it!

head_text.subj: I'VE GOT A MESSAGE FOR STINGER.
TELL STINGER MAVERICK HAS GOOD NEWS
AND SOME BAD NEWS. THE GOOD NEWS IS
THAT ICE GOT A MIG. THE BAD NEWS IS

text: Ice considers for a moment, then responds.
I know. I know....Aw hell, let's do  it!
Then...shit! Go ahead. I'm right  behind you.
128.  PRI-FLY BRIDGE - (Primary Flight Control)  USS KITT
The Air Boss speaks to Maverick over the UHF. The Admiral the XO and other officers watch and listen.

(surpressing a grin) ...Likes to break at 600, 'stead of  300 knots. The Air Boss hates him.  One time, he came over the deck at  two hundred, shakes the shit out of  the bridge. Lifted Johnson right  off his feet.
He glances over at Ice, who gives him thumbs up.

head_text.subj: BOSS, YOU BETTER CLEAR IT OUT,

text: The Admiral looks out over the water and smiles.

head_text.subj: TEN MILES ASTERN, BOSS. HOW ABOUT

text: The Air Boss is livid. He clenches the mike.
Just then the Admiral pipes up.

The Admiral looks at the others, tries to surpress his ow grin. He slides into his (borrowed) command chair, looks the wind. On the back of the chair, a clue; his name and  rank:  RADM. Buford Clancy, "BOOMER"
The AIR BOSS burns, but has no choice.
(really pissed off) ROGER, GHOST RIDER, YOU'RE CLEAR.

Sailors line the deck and search the sky. They crane thei necks from their battle stations, sweating into the sun,  watching for the approach of F-14's. Someone sees it--he  points and SHOUTS. The F-14 appears, and every man stands CHEERS.
WE COME SCREAMING IN, 5 FEET OVER THE WATER, throwing up  rooster tails behind. WE SPLIT OFF and ZOOM along each si of the carrier, at 100 feet and ROLL IT.
It lifts the Air Boss right off his feet. The walls warp, dust sifts from the overhead. The whole tower just goes B

They break at 500 knots. Ice is first down over the ramp, waved in.  The F-14 comes in a little rocky. It bounces h but grabs the wire, then jerks to a sudden halt. The sail CHEER AND APPLAUD, throwing fists of victory into the air straining to get a look at Ice as the crew directs his pl off to the side. Opening the canopy, Ice and Slider unstr Stinger and the others are there. Guys are climbing up,  climbing all over the airplane. They're already painting MiG on the side, and they're looking at Ice in awe.
He catches the wire, the view slams down toward the deck the plane arrests, then comes up...He releases the cockpi and can hear the ROAR OF THE CROWD...

He swings the nose around past Ice's. Ice's plane is cove in colored jerseys as the ground crew pulls him out.  Maverick's plane swings towards the PRI-FLY BRIDGE. Pilot flightsuits pour from the deck hatch APPLAUDING...

As Maverick and Fungus climb down, they see their wingmen the deck. Ice is looking in Maverick's direction. His fac inscrutable. Maverick gets mobbed, but pushes over to Ice They stare at each other for a moment, eye to eye even as they are buffeted by the crowd. Finally, Ice breaks...a g
I guess I owe you one.
You don't owe me anything. We're on the same team.
You saved our lives. You did it!
You're a hell of a flyer. (he can't resist)
You can be my wingman any time.
Now Ice laughs. Nobody's ever gonna win on this one. But smiles at him...It's now a running joke between them.

He and Slider snap to and proudly salute. Maverick  hesitates, then returns it. As Ice and Slider snap it off turns into the pilot's salute, they give them the bird.  Maverick and Fungus laugh and return the compliment.
As they are mobbed by sailors, Maverick is elated to see familiar figures: Hollywood and Wolfman turn from their  battle damaged TOMCAT on the forward elevator as it sinks of sight below decks.
He got our radio, and an engine. We  were lucky to make it back.
Stinger rushes up, grabs Ice and Maverick in a bear hug.
MiG killers! You name it, boy.  Sky's the limit. You name it. A  medal. Anything you want. Anything.
MiG killers!  What else is there?
Maverick grins, turns away from them.  He he looks out, a the dying sun glinting over the sea. He thinks how beauti it is out here! Fungus grabs him from behind.
You hear that? Anything we want.  Anything...Well???
They don't seem to want to come up  anymore. There's nothing on the  scopes. In fact, everybody's  denying the incident ever happened.  So...what is it?  What do you want?
Maverick turns away, considering the options.
Another Tomcat rolls up to park nearby. He looks  at the plane. Over the deck LOUDSPEAKER, comes the  final call to the F-14:

head_text.subj: OKAY, GENTLEMEN. YOU CAN CUT YOUR
AS THE ENGINES FADE, SO DOES THE PICTURE.

text: Viper, Jester and others walk out of hangar to watch a wi return.
THEIR POV. Suddenly an F-14 breaks, ROARS in over the fie inverted, a hundred feet off the ground.
Well, he's in trouble and he didn't  even get here yet.
Jester looks over at an admiral, who steps out of a staff car, squints up at the swooping plane, turns, barks an or to his driver, jumps in the car and SLAMS the door, the c takes off.
MP jeeps - lights flashing, pull out and head for the fli line.

head_text.subj: OVER THE END OF THE RUNWAY

text: The jet breaks at 500 knots and sets down neatly on the  tarmac. The rest of his flight follows in perfect formati
He unbuckles his straps, takes his helmet off. He looks o at the approaching caravan.
I think they know we're here.
Oh, no. You did the flying, I'll do  the talking!
He stands up in the cockpit, gives a snappy salute.
Why Admiral....How really good it  is to see you!
Maverick turns away. As he backs down the steps, a jeep  screeches up, doors slam open, footsteps.
He's answered automatically, but now it hits him. He know the voice. He turns.
Not for long, you keep that up.
He hops down, stands there speechless, grinning happily a her.
You got your F-14, you got Top Gun,  you got your MiGs....You're our new  Top Gun instructor...Now what?
Oh...I'll think of something...  What are you doing here?
He's got her on that one. She laughs.
He puts his arms around her. Self-conscious, she pulls aw a little embarrassed to show this on the flight line. He  laughs.
That's okay. I always look forward  to a challenge.
Now she laughs back and puts her arms around him. She kis him and now she doesn't give a damn who sees it.
